main event: An observation of a comet-like object in Idaho on 24 June 1947.
interesting points: The object was reported as stationary and appeared to hang in the sky., The object was described as having the shape of a 'comet.', There was speculation that the observation might have been of a bright planet, such as Saturn or Mercury, depending on the time of day., An unconfirmed source suggested the observation time was 3:30 P.M., which limits astronomical explanations to a meteor train., The document contains evaluations indicating that astronomical phenomena were the most probable explanation for the sighting.
